adjectives.description: attributive (comparative more attributive, superlative most attributive)

entries.meaning: (grammar, of a word or phrase) Modifying another word, typically a noun, while in the same phrase.
examples: In "this big house", "big" is attributive, whereas in "this house is big", it is predicative.
In "this tiger is a man-eater," "man" is an attributive noun.

entries.meaning: Attributing; characterized by attributing; effecting attribution.
(grammar) An attributive word or phrase (see above), contrasted with predicative or substantive.
examples: In "this big house," "big" is an attributive, while in "this house is big," it is a predicative.
